page.title: 09 THE HAWTHORNS SCHOOL
page.content: The school serving the{Woosehill} development was origionally designed as a one form Primary school and opened in 1981 by a pupil.The site was the only one of three allocated by the County Council to be used,due to legal and economic difficulties.The name{"Hawthorns"}was chosen by the head;the school logo,depicting a spray of hawthorn,was designed by a pupil. Planning took six months.The main problems included insufficent cash allocation,selection of staff and difficulty in detailed planning in the absence of any accurate prediction of the number of children expected. Plans to extend the school were proposed soon after the school opened. Building of the extension was completed in September 1984 doubling the size of the school.Numbers are expected to peak at 400 in 1986.
